text: is there a conditional I can use to check if the page displayed is a blog entry or blog listing vs being a standard website page?
Oh, that's a blog post vs a blog listing, not site page
Blogs have a `group` variable and I don't think regular pages do, you could check against that

<@U98Q2GNL9> not sure if you use the developer info at all in HS but there is alot of information in there with values you can use to check against for multiple things. <http://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/how-to-use-developer-info-on-cos-pages>
This works, but needs to be customized from site to site.
No problem. I use it daily for things.

I just wanted to add this in as I just finished writing up and article about some alternatives to Google Enterprise Site Search. 
<https://blog.wsol.com/four-alternatives-to-googles-enterprise-site-search-for-HubSpot>

Under the SEO Optimization on pages/posts, I am seeing `Page has images without alt text.` However, only images without alt are from the social media sharing buttons module where there are `img`'s with display none on them, can we get alt text added to these so this error doesnt show up. Currently its the FB thumb image
